Navigation
Name Test/Libraries/List/takeWhile
Synopsis Take elements from the front of the list as long as a predicate is true.
Function list[&T] takeWhile(list[&T] lst, bool (&T a) take)
Usage import List;
Examples 
rascal>import List;
ok
rascal>bool isEven(int a) = a mod 2 == 0;
bool (int): bool isEven(int);
rascal>takeWhile([2,4,6,8,1,2,3,4,5],isEven);
list[int]: [2,4,6,8]

Questions
Question [1].
The type of takeWhile([6], bool(int x){ return x > 0;}) is

Question [2]. 
takeWhile([5, 6, -1], bool(int x){ return x > 0;}) ==

Question [3]. 
takeWhile([-2, -7, -10, -11, 0, -4], ) == [-2,-7,-10,-11]
